thread.title: Athens, Abby wins set up key matchup in finale
thread.title_full: Athens, Abby wins set up key matchup in finale

title: Athens, Abby wins set up key matchup in finale
text:
Athens, Abby wins set up key matchup in finale Mitchell A. Skurzewski 11:12 p.m. CDT October 9, 2015 Football roundup. CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Abbotsford Falcons football team is one week away from securing an undefeated season. Even with an unblemished 8-0 record after Friday’s 34-12 victory over Loyal, the Falcons still haven’t wrapped up a Cloverwood Conference title. 
Behind a huge night from Jake Stange, the Athens Bluejays improved to 7-1 with a matchup against Abbotsford in the final week of the regular season looming. Athens has bounced back from a rough performance against Assumption and can earn a co-conference title with a win over the Falcons. 
Other teams with important games in Week 8 included Wausau West, Mosinee and Colby. Wausau West has gotten itself off the deck and has done it with standout defense. Wausau West sat at 0-4 after four weeks, but has now won three of its last four games, including a 20-0 shutout effort on Friday. In their three wins, the Warriors’ defense has allowed a total of 14 points. 
Wausau West now sits at 3-4 in the VFA-South and 3-5 overall. With a win in the final week of the regular season against Appleton West, the Warriors will have a .500 conference record and will be playoff eligible. 
Mosinee sat at 3-3 — a game against Weston was canceled — and faced a 5-2 Merrill team on the road. With the 33-16 win Mosinee assured itself of finishing at least .500 in conference play and can clinch a playoff spot with a win over Lakeland. 
Mosinee’s defense had been struggling all year, including giving up 68 total points in back-to-back losses Antigo and Medford. But, Mosinee’s defense answered the bell with an outstanding performance on Friday and with Lakeland on the docket, Mosinee has an outstanding chance of clinching a playoff spot next week after becoming playoff eligible on Friday. 
Landon Stepan had a nice performance for Mosinee with 180 yards and two touchdowns through the air, 131 of those yards to Bryce Graveen, and added 80 yards and a touchdown on the ground. 
The Colby Hornets are not assured of a playoff spot even by winning the final two weeks, but it gives them hope. Colby dismantled Osseo-Fairchild 43-16 in Week 8 and has Neillsville standing in its path of potentially earning a postseason berth. 
Adams-Friendship earned a big win, downing Mauston 32-14 to become playoff eligible at 5-3. A-F is 2-2 in conference and can clinch a berth with a win over Wisconsin Dells, which won its first South Central Conference game over Westfield in Week 8.
